title: Bryan Cranston reveals transformation into Breaking Bad Walter White
text:
Bryan Cranston has revealed the hard work that goes into his Walter White look for Breaking Bad.

In an impressive time lapse video, the actor sits in the makeup chair while a team of professionals transform him into the iconic character.

First his hair is gelled down and then hidden under a bald cap which is carefully glued into place to create Walter’s bald head.

A makeup artists sprays the cap and a natural skin colour so the hair line blends in with the rest of the actor’s face.

Walter’s mustache also takes a fair bit of time to perfect, as in the video shows the fake piece of facial hair being put and removed a few times before it is painstakingly glued into place.

Sharing the video on Instagram, Bryan joked: ‘I don’t know why filming takes so long, I became Walter White in less than a minute.’

He thanked the hard-working experts behind Walter’s look – Head of Make up Cheri Montesanto, key make up artist Laverne Munroe and prosthetic make up artist Garrett Immel.

Cranston wears a bald cap to play the character (Picture: Instagram)

His facial hair is carefully put in place (Picture: Instagram)

The science teacher turned drug dealer popped up in the Breaking Bad film El Camino, but Bryan had one condition on reprising the role…Walter had to still be dead.

Speaking to Rolling Stone, the 63-year-old actor said: ‘I would say that yes, if [Breaking Bad creator Vince Gilligan] came to me and said, “Let’s do the series again. Walter White didn’t die. Let’s just say that, and then we’ll see if we can get two or three more years out of it,” that’s when I would have to say, “I don’t think we should”.’

Cranston and Aaron Paul starred in Breaking Bad, which ran for five seasons (Picture: AMC)

He added: ‘What he wrote for the conclusion of the series is, to me, perfect. So I think that would be a problem if he wanted to. But I know he doesn’t.’

His co-star Aaron Paul takes the lead as Jesse Pinkman, with Walter and other deceased characters such as Mike Ehrmantraut appearing in a series of flashbacks.
